meanings.sent1: She treasured the precieuse necklace her grandmother gave her.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed many precieuse artifacts from ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The pirate captain searched for the precieuse gem rumored to bring good luck.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a precieuse gem in a sea of frowns.

meanings.definition: A person who is excessively concerned with their appearance or manners
meanings.sent1: The precieuse spent hours perfecting her makeup before the party.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the precieuse of the group, always dressed to impress.
meanings.sent3: The precieuse checked her reflection in every shiny surface she passed.
meanings.sent4: Her obsession with being a precieuse made her miss out on the fun.
meanings.sent5: The precieuse's attention to detail in her outfit was unmatched by anyone else.

meanings.definition: A style of literature or art characterized by refined language and elaborate wit
meanings.sent1: The writer's work was considered precieuse due to its intricate prose.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed reading precieuse poetry that challenged her intellect.
meanings.sent3: The play was a precieuse masterpiece of clever dialogue and humor.
meanings.sent4: His paintings were a blend of precieuse elegance and modern flair.
meanings.sent5: The precieuse novel transported readers to a world of sophistication and charm.
